intro: Eriocaulon compactum, commonly known as the compact spikerush, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Native to wetland and marshy habitats, it thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in temperate regions. The plant has a compact growth habit, with short, sturdy stems and narrow leaves. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various insect and microbial life.
